skill.name: creating-agents
skill.description:
Creates Claude Code subagents for task delegation. Guides through agent configuration,
tool selection, and system prompts. Use this skill when the user wants to create a new agent,
delegate tasks to specialists, or asks about subagents.

content.value_statement: This skill guides you through creating Claude Code subagents for task delegation. It provides step-by-step instructions for agent configuration, tool selection, and system prompt design.

Explain tool selection based on principle of least privilege
Offer reusable templates for common agent types

Does not install or configure Claude Code itself

best_practices: Grant minimum tools needed using principle of least privilege
Include trigger words in description for automatic selection
Keep system prompts focused on single clear purpose
Store project agents in .claude/agents/ for team sharing
anti_patterns: Granting all tools to every agent increases risk
Vague descriptions prevent automatic agent selection
Overly long prompts dilute agent focus
Storing sensitive configuration in agent files

faq.question: What tools should I grant to my agent?
faq.answer: Grant minimum tools needed. Use Read, Glob, and Grep for analysis-only agents. Add Write and Edit only when modification is required.

faq.question: Where should I store project agents?
faq.answer: Store project-specific agents in .claude/agents/ within your project directory. They take priority over user-level agents.

faq.question: Can agents spawn other agents?
faq.answer: Yes. Grant the Task tool to allow agents to spawn subagents. Use this for multi-agent workflows where tasks are delegated.

faq.question: Is my data safe with custom agents?
faq.answer: Yes. Agent files are local Markdown configuration. No data is sent externally. Agents run within your Claude Code environment.

faq.question: Why is my agent not being selected?
faq.answer: Check that the name uses lowercase with hyphens, description includes trigger words, and file is in correct location (.claude/agents/).

faq.question: How is this different from built-in agents?
faq.answer: Built-in agents handle general tasks. Custom agents provide domain-specific expertise, restricted tool sets, and proactive invocation for specialized workflows.
